name: (C) Brk. HP FS (Other Fossil Furnace & AC)
_description: Ultra high performance air source heat pump fully replacing original distillate furnace equipment

notes: COP = SEER / 3.412, COP = HSPF / 3.412 (see EIA source)
split system conversion factors SEER2/SEER = 0.95, HSPF2/HSPF = 0.85 (see RESNET source)

source_data.title: Draft PDS:01, MINHERS Addendum 71, SEER2/HSPF2 Conversions
source_data.author: RESNET

source_data.title: Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation 2014
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

notes: Uses residential system costs and normalizes by typical capacity of residential systems (36 kBtu/h)
See 'Best' costs, but assuming that electrical upgrade costs ($7K) are avoided for existing.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

source_data.title: Residential End Uses: Area 2: Incremental Installed Costs for Efficiency Upgrades

source_data.title: Service Upgrades for Electrification Retrofits Study Final Report
source_data.author: NV5 and Redwood Energy

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

notes: Heating multiple of 21% was determined by dividing square feet in which main heating equipment is oil or propane furnace (961852 sf) by square feet in switch main heating equipment is oil or propane furnace or packaged unit (4543002 sf)

cooling multiple of 37% was determined by dividing square feet in which cooling equipment is residential split system or individual AC unit AND heating equipment is not natural gas or electric (13428155 sf) by square feet with same cooling constraint and heating across all fossil fuel types (36556957 sf).
